text: Francisco Moya, O.F.M. was a Roman Catholic prelate who served as Bishop of Rubicón (1436–?). ==Biography== Francisco Moya was ordained a priest in the Order of Friars Minor. On 26 Sep 1436, he was appointed during the papacy of Pope Eugene IV as Bishop of Rubicón. On 27 Oct 1436, he was consecrated bishop by André Dias de Escobar, Titular Bishop of Megara. It is uncertain how long he served as Bishop of Rubicón; the next bishop of record is Juan de Frías, who was appointed in 1474. == References == ==External links and additional sources== * (for Chronology of Bishops) * (for Chronology of Bishops) Category:15th-century Roman Catholic bishops Category:Bishops appointed by Pope Eugene IV Category:Franciscan bishops
title: Francisco Moya (bishop)
